Detailed Description

Class Participant used to group Publishers and Subscribers into a single working unit.

Member Function Documentation

◆ get_no_publishers()

int get_no_publishers ( char *  target_topic)

This method returns the number of Publishers that currently belong to the Participant that have a given topic name.

Parameters
target_topicTarget topic name to match
Returns
Number of Publishers in the Participant with that topic name

◆ get_no_subscribers()

This method return the number of Subscribers that currently belong to the Participant that have a given topic name.

target_topicTarget topic name to match
Returns
Number of Subscribers in the Participant with that topic name

◆ getEDPReaders()

std::pair<StatefulReader*,StatefulReader*> getEDPReaders ( )

This method returns a pointer to the Endpoint Discovery Protocol Readers (when not in Static mode) SimpleEDP creates two readers, one for Publishers and one for Subscribers, and they are both returned as a std::pair of pointers.

These readers in particular have modified listeners that allow a slave listener to attach its callbach to the original one, allowing for the addition of logging elements.

Returns
std::pair of pointers to the EDP Readers

◆ newRemoteEndpointDiscovered()

bool newRemoteEndpointDiscovered ( const GUID_t &  partguid,
uint16_t  userId,
EndpointKind_t  kind 
)

Called when using a StaticEndpointDiscovery mechanism different that the one included in FastRTPS, for example when communicating with other implementations.

It indicates to the Participant that an Endpoint from the XML has been discovered and should be activated.

Parameters
partguidParticipant GUID_t.
userIdUser defined ID as shown in the XML file.
kindEndpointKind (WRITER or READER)
Returns
True if correctly found and activated.
